Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION: Supervision in question as sexual contact occurred between two
residents.
INVESTIGATION:
I reviewed intake dated 02/16/2022. It states sexual contact occurred between
Youth A and B within the last two months at the facility.
2

I reviewed Doctor email to facility dated 02/16/2022. It states during a physical
exam Youth A inquired about vaginal swab testing and disclosed having sexual
encounters with Youth B during the previous two months at the facility.
I interviewed Manager onsite on 03/01/2022. He reports Youth A being placed at
the facility on 10/11/2021, whereas Youth B was placed on 11/01/2021 in the girl’s
non-secure/New Beginnings (NB) unit and in separate bedrooms. Youth A and B
were consequently placed in the same bedroom from 01/11/2022 through
01/22/2022 due to COVID quarantine. Youth A and B were taken out of quarantine
on 01/22/202 though remained roommates through 02/07/2022 when another
bedroom was made available and the two no longer were roommates. Youth’s A
and B were then placed in separate buildings on 02/16/2022 due to the allegations
of this investigation.
I interviewed Detective, via telephone, on 03/02/2022. He reports participating in a
Kids-Talk interview with Youth B on 02/28/2022. He reports the initial allegations
noted that the sexual contact between Youth A and B was consensual. Youth B
wrote a letter to her teacher noting that Youth A, one time a month ago, pulled down
Youth B’s pants while sleeping and humped her without any penetration. Youth B
notes that the incident was “between rounds”.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 03/02/2022. She reports one incident of sexual
touching occurring between her and Youth A approximately one month ago and that
it did not last long, only a couple of minutes. She states being placed in room #9
and that the incident occurred at approximately 10pm. She states staff walks by
every 15 minutes noting Staff Person 1 usually does the checks. She states Staff
Person 1 may have been doing the checks hourly though admits she may not have
seen Staff Person 1 walk by.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 03/18/2022. She reports previously being COVID
roommates with Youth B. She reports sexual touching occurring a few times the last
month just after bedtime which could be 8:30pm or 9:30pm. She states they would
engage in such behavior after staff would walk by their bedroom. She states staff
would walk by their bedroom every 10 to 15 minutes noting that staff would change
on different nights.
I interviewed Staff Person 1, via telephone, on 03/22/2022. She reports having
worked midnight shifts, and day shifts, when 15-minute bed checks would be
completed. She reports the process of bed checks is to view inside resident
bedrooms every 15 minutes and then turn the key-switch to notify the control room
as a unit bed check being completed. She states that bed checks are not typically
missed though some may have occurred beyond 15 minutes due to issues occurring
with residents during the check. She cannot specifically recall when one of these
instances may have occurred. Staff Person 1 states she was made aware of the
alleged inappropriate touching between Youths A and B and states she did not

observe the two engaged in any act while doing her checks, and states that it did not
occur on her watch.
I reviewed the facility’s Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log) forms from
01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times of 09:30PM through 07:00AM, which
includes the following building/unit: BTS, J-1 UP, J-1 DN, J-ll, NB, DELTA, and MP.
The form is used by the campus’ control room staff to document each

the unit completes a bed-check they contact the control room through a key-check or
call-in who then enters an “X” on the form as verification of a check being done for
that for fifteen-minute period. An “0” means that a check was “Missed”, per the
forms key.

There were no Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log) forms from
01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times between 07:00AM and 09:30PM for
Youth A and B while placed in quarantine in the same bedroom. Manager reports
fifteen-minute checks of residents as occurring which could be verified through video
monitoring.
I interviewed Manager 2 onsite on 03/02/2022. He reports no logging forms would
have occurred forms from 01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times between
07:00AM and 09:30PM for Youth A and B while placed in quarantine in the same
bedroom stating they were being checked on every 15 minutes by staff on the unit.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 03/18/2022. She states being transferred from the
girls non-secured unit to the girls secured unit recently.
I interviewed Manager 1 onsite on 03/18/2022. He states Youth A being transferred
from the girls non-secure, NB program (license #CE630201060) to the short-term
secure program (license #CE630201058) due to behavioral issues. No discharge
paperwork had been completed upon Youth A’s discharge from the NB program and
placement in the more restrictive short-term secure program.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
5

ANALYSIS: There is no conclusive evidence to indicate variable interval
checks of residents were not being performed on Youth A and B
when they engaged in some form of sexual behavior. Youth A
and B report staff making 15-minutes bed checks while they
were placed together.
There is evidence to indicate that variable interval checks of
residents do not occur every 15-minutes consistently. Review of
the facility’s Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log)
forms from 01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times of
09:30PM through 07:00AM, to include building/units BTS, NB,
and DELTA verifies missed or not documented bed checks as
occurring.
TECHNICAL The facility does not use the facility’s Emergency Alarm System
ASSSISTANCE: (Key and Phone Log) forms to document 15-minute checks of
residents in quarantine during daytime hours. The facility
reports checks as occurring through normal programming on the
unit during the day. It is recommended that the facility use its
Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log) form for all
residents in quarantine and out of the direct line of sight of staff
to verify 15-minute checks as occurring.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4166 Discharge plan.
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional care, al

(license #CE630201060) to the short-term secure program
(license #CE630201058) due to behavioral issues. No
discharge paperwork had been completed upon Youth A’s
discharge from the NB program.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
